briefdescription.para: Does the chdir, fork, setsid, etc.

parameterdescription.para: file descriptor to print daemon's pid to, or -1 for none
TRUE to keep the original umask

briefdescription.para: Creates a file containing the process ID.
Writes the given pid_to_write to a pidfile (if non-NULL) and/or to a pipe (if non-NULL).

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if pidfile and print_pid_pipe are both NULL.

parameterdescription.para: the file to write to or NULL
the pipe to write to or NULL

briefdescription.para: Verify that after the fork we can successfully change to this user.

parameterdescription.para: the username given in the daemon configuration

briefdescription.para: Changes the user and group the bus is running as.
Attempt to ensure that the current process can open at least file descriptors.

detaileddescription.para: If is lower than the current, it will not be lowered. No error is returned if the request can not be satisfied.

briefdescription.para: Log a message to the system log file (e.g.
Log a message to the system log file (e.g.

detaileddescription.para:
severity
a severity value
msg
a printf-style format string
args
arguments for the format string
If the FATAL severity is given, this function will terminate the program with an error code.

briefdescription.para: Installs a signal handler.
stat() wrapper.

parameterdescription.para: the stat info to fill in

briefdescription.para: Open a directory to iterate over.

simplesect.para: new iterator, or NULL on error

briefdescription.para: Get next file in the directory.

detaileddescription.para: Will not return "." or ".." on UNIX. If an error occurs, the contents of "filename" are undefined. The error is never set if the function succeeds.

xrefdescription.para: for thread safety, I think we have to use readdir_r(). (GLib has the same issue, should file a bug.)

parameterdescription.para: string to be set to the next file in the dir

simplesect.para: TRUE if filename was filled in with a new filename

briefdescription.para: Closes a directory iteration.
Get the directory name from a complete filename.

parameterdescription.para: string to append directory name to

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID matches the UID of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on Windows.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this uid owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the Windows user SID matches the owner of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on UNIX.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this user owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID is at the console.

detaileddescription.para: Should always fail on Windows (set the error to DBUS_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED).

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID is the same as the console user and there are no errors

briefdescription.para: Parse a UNIX group from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Parse a UNIX user from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Gets all groups corresponding to the given UNIX user ID.

detaileddescription.para: On UNIX, just calls _dbus_groups_from_uid(). On Windows, should always fail since we don't know any UNIX groups.

parameterdescription.para: return location for array of group IDs
return location for length of returned array

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID existed and we got some credentials

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned long pid, DBusString *str, int max_len, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_command_for_pid

briefdescription.para: Get a printable string describing the command used to execute the process with pid.

detaileddescription.para: This string should only be used for informative purposes such as logging; it may not be trusted.
The command is guaranteed to be printable ASCII and no longer than max_len.

ref.tooltip: A boolean, valid values are TRUE and FALSE.
